revised_title: Flow Dynamics in a Curved Tube of Triangular Cross Section
tldr: The authors investigate the steady flow of a viscous fluid under a constant pressure gradient in a curved tube with a uniform triangular cross-section. They provide numerical solutions for the range 100-12000 of the Dean number and examine the development of a boundary-layer structure as the Dean number increases. The results show some agreement with an asymptotic model proposed by Smith (1976) but also reveal discrepancies in the precise details.
